programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes contestants about real news stories with unreal outcomes to see if they can earn some cash. In "Oddball Olympics," locals learn about a bizarre world record, a middle school shooting star and a super swimming dog.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Kar is a selfless soul known for his unwavering commitment to the unhoused in his community. It's Kar's turn to have some good old-fashioned fun.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Everything's better fried, right? Chefs Melanie Kerr and Colin Liang put that hypothesis to the test in this Fry Fest challenge. Will their ideas come out crisped to perfection, or sad and soggy?

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob takes the plunge with both old and new water-based activities, including paddleboard yoga, snowmobiling on the water, scuba diving and sailing.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Immerse yourself in Santa Fe, New Mexico's unique charms! Delve into the bizarre art of Meow Wolf, sample a decadent chocolate flight, and savor a local speciality, the green chile burger. Embrace the unusual in this truly exceptional journey!

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Davin hits the streets in his new tree costume and attempts to jump-scare passersby. Ryan then offers them a chance to win money by answering trivia questions. Later, Justin surprises an old friend with a rare cat she has dreamt of owning for years.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether it’s a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Can Chef Colton Colburn-Wood of Cosmica in Boston trip up Chef Erin Miller of Urban Hearth in Cambridge? Both chefs skillfully build simple to complex foundations. But who will correctly replicate and get theirs plated in time?

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Three jewelry makers in Greenville are about to take on some heavy metal as they go head-to-head to design and build an arm cuff inspired by the Liberty Bridge. Will their designs be too arm-twisting for the judges?

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Beach-inspired resin art in Boston, and elaborate charcuterie boards in Omaha.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: If it’s pleasure you seek, you’ll find it here. Delight in sipping luxurious wines or crave elevated dining experiences? Satisfy your urges in this alluring town. We’ll take you on a thrilling ride and bring you to fields that glow.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Having a little fun on the town is great but it's even better when you're doing it thriftily. Join Maddy & Dixie as they make a little cash go a long way, seeking out the best activities that’ll have you ballin’ on a budget!

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Maria's destruction in Puerto Rico, Justin and Ryan fly down to help communities rebuild and help families any way they can.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Single Samuel is a man on the move looking to find the right woman to settle down with and start a family in Sacramento. He’s in for a treat with a trip to a goat farm, a loop around a rollerskating rink and a very revealing art experience.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Sierra Lamar leaves for school one morning and vanishes with barely a trace, setting in motion one of the largest searches in U.S. history. The community and investigators still have unanswered questions.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Veteran NYC Chef Ten Vong squares up against Jimmy's Famous Seafood rep Charlie Wickboldt. Watch these chefs transform their colorful careers into even more colorful plates. Who will find the tomato trophy at the end of the rainbow?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: It's 5 o'clock in Baltimore! Belly up to the bar and watch Chefs Kevanna Gilmore and Cat Smith battle it out. Who will shake up the competition, and who will end up on the rocks?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Drink some ‘shockingly’ good brew. Ride shotgun in a motorcycle sidecar as you tour the local wine country. Share a life-size mimosa with a friend and fall asleep on a working farm where you can literally count sheep.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Kinga is in Manchester, NH, to meet Matt Krajcik, a 26-year-old curriculum developer who survived a trying childhood. Now he is looking to reconnect to the nature around him that provided respite when he was young.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Decades-old cold cases are finally solved thanks to advances in DNA technology.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate regains her faith in the classic Hurricane, talks history and equity in the cocktail industry, pledges allegiance to the French 75, and dives into a rich New Orleans cocktail culture that’s much bigger than Bourbon Street.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Queen of Cupcakes Chef Sumayyah Bilal is up against Pound Cake King Tre-von Clark in this royal bake-off. Which chef will take the cake? And who will be burned by the competition?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: When it comes to nature, Maddie Carlin is a self-proclaimed Debbie Downer. Kinga is in Milwaukee to convince her to give nature another chance. They’re traveling across the state, looking for an adventure to inspire Maddie to get off the couch!

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Find out why they call them 'yum yums,' make a toast in the Bourbon Capital of the World and follow the clues on a murder mystery train. Want to spend the night with a spector? Stay the night in a former jail that's now a haunted B&B.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are always looking for that next new thing. Join them as they explore a few of Sactown's surprising offerings, from mobile archery to an intimate cocktail bar with over 700 bottles of unique liquor.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan dodges the fangs of venomous snakes, suits up to wrangle bees and sell local honey, and dives headfirst into protecting the future of Florida's coral reefs.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch recognizes the feel-good, do-good and all-around good from across the country. This episode shares stories of Americans spreading kindness, from kids making a difference to stories of people helping veterans in need.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Two couples sample bites from around the world, cozy up in nature, get hopped up on caffeine and seek out a yoga glow on two blind dates in Orlando.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After eight members of one family were killed in their homes in a single night, residents of the devastated Ohio community were left to wonder if they were next.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to quiz people on the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Imagination Station," contestants answer questions for cash about witty co-workers, life-saving screenings and teaching telemarketers a lesson.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.desc: Weeks after a pregnant woman is shot and killed in Orlando, a shootout between her suspected killer and a police officer sparks a manhunt.

programme.title: Arctic Animals
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll feature animals that live in the freezing arctic. Learn how the Polar Bear has developed special adaptations that help it survive in the most unforgiving climate imaginable. And why the Wolverine is able to hunt so efficiently in the snow.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science behind man's best friend - the dog. Find out what makes a greyhound so fast. See how a bloodhound's nose really works, and the reason that border collies are so intelligent is revealed.

programme.title: Deserts
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Mohave Desert, and discovers how varied deserts can be; some deserts are covered with sand dunes, while others have amazing vegetation. We also travel to Death Valley, the hottest spot in North America. Then we explore the Joshua Tree National Park, which has the unusual Joshua tree, and many other exotic plants.

programme.title: Canyons
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to the Grand Canyon by helicopter, and gives us a close look at this amazing canyon, which is considered one of the seven natural wonders of the world. We'll also visit Bryce Canyon and its fascinating "hoodoos," which are rock formations sculpted by weather. We'll also dive into the Monterrey Bay and discover an incredible underwater canyon that features some unusual sea creatures.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: Rt 66: Oklahoma
programme.desc: A Photowalk along historic Route 66 continues in Oklahoma, where Jefferson Graham takes you to some of the most beautiful and unique places to explore.
